page.title: 19EDUCATION
page.content:
LYNEAL VILLAGE by Helen Marshall (extracted from a piece of writing)
"The stackyard's Dutch barn had a corrugated iron roof bent into a curve. Parallel were the lines on the roof. A truss held up a beam at the end. It had no sides. We walked on and soon came to a very interesting stone wall. Colours: rich browns merged with ivy coloured moss. Deep greens lurked in the shadows and crevices deep. Sizes were none the same;big,little, fat and slim,round, rough and smooth. Texturally, the stones were like dogs' noses, sharp and jagged, bumpy and dipping."
